data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in US Antitrust Case
data.Description: A US federal judge ruled that Google has acted illegally to maintain a monopoly in the online search market.  The ruling could have significant implications for the tech giant and may lead to changes in how it operates.

data.Title: Microsoft Bing Sees Opportunity Following Google Antitrust Ruling
data.Description: With Google facing potential consequences from its recent antitrust ruling, Microsoft executives believe there is an opening for its Bing search engine to gain market share.

data.Title: Apple Rejected Bing as Safari's Default Search Engine
data.Description: Newly revealed details from the Google antitrust case show that Apple consistently refused to replace Google with Bing as the default search engine for Safari, citing Bing's poor quality.

data.Title: Elon Musk's X Sues Advertising Alliance Over Alleged Antitrust Violations
data.Description: Elon Musk's X (formerly Twitter) has filed a federal lawsuit against the Global Alliance for Responsible Media (GARM) and several of its members, alleging antitrust activity related to advertising practices.

data.Title: Google Search Console Launches New Recommendations Feature
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out an experimental "Recommendations" feature, providing website owners with personalized suggestions to improve their site's performance in search results.

data.Title: Google Trends Gets a Design Refresh
data.Description: Google Trends has introduced a redesigned interface for its trending now page, offering users enhanced filtering capabilities and more detailed keyword data.

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Testing "See Also" Carousel with Competitors
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new "see also" carousel on Google Business Profiles, potentially displaying local competitors directly beneath a business's listing.

data.Title: Beware of SEO Scams Promising Paid Google Ranking Fixes
data.Description: Google is warning users about an ongoing SEO scam where individuals are tricked into paying for fake services that claim to improve their website's ranking in Google Search.

data.Title: Google Ads Bug Displayed Ads for Competing Merchants
data.Description: Google has acknowledged a bug in its Google Ads platform that resulted in some advertisers' ads being displayed alongside products from competing merchants. The company plans to issue credits to affected advertisers.

data.Title: Microsoft Denies Bing Search Algorithm Update in May
data.Description: Microsoft has refuted claims of a significant Bing Search algorithm update around May 29th, stating that no unusual releases occurred during that period.

data.Title: Google Search Traffic Remains Strong Despite AI Competition
data.Description: A recent report indicates that Google's search traffic has continued to grow, showing no significant impact from the emergence of new AI-powered search engines.

data.Title: Google Lens Adds Voice Context to Video Searches
data.Description: Google Lens now allows users to record videos and add voice context to their searches, enhancing the visual search experience.

data.Title: OpenAI Develops ChatGPT Watermarking Tool, But Hesitates to Release
data.Description: OpenAI has created a watermarking method that can identify text generated by ChatGPT with 99.9% accuracy, but internal debates have delayed its public release.

data.Title: CNET Acquired by Ziff Davis for Over \$100 Million
data.Description: Red Ventures has sold CNET, a pioneering online tech publication, to Ziff Davis, the parent company of Mashable, PC Mag, and other media brands.

data.Title: Reddit Reports Strong Q2 Earnings with Revenue Growth
data.Description: Reddit's Q2 earnings revealed a 54% year-over-year increase in revenue, reaching \$281.2 million. The platform also saw significant growth in daily active users.
